description.narrative: The project aims to improve standards of education in the Voi district of Kenya and at the same time improve employability of young Kenyan school leavers, contributing to reducing Kenya’s alarmingly high unemployment rate. This project will enlarge on a previous similar project run by The Applicant in Kenya from 2010-2012. High schools will be provided with internet-ready computer laboratories and training sessions will be provided for teachers on how to make use of ICT and project-based learning. The ability to utilize these computers has already had proven success in raising standards of education in Kenya;

These schools, plus schools provided with computers through the previous project, will then be able to set up Practice Enterprise Networks as part of the “Europen” initiative. This will mean that pupils can set up Practice business firms and conduct simulated business in realistic conditions. Though this will initially take place only in the schools selected for this project, the practice enterprise network will be a national agreement, and eventually any Kenyan school, job centre or other educational establishment with ICT facilities will be able to take part. ;

This hands-on business experience will dramatically improve the employability of young Kenyans who participate. As will be explained, the project contributes to gender equality and conservation issues and will increase the level of international cooperation between Kenya and Slovakia.;

activity-date.narrative: Actual end of the project according to the contract with SlovakAid
The date of signing the contract with SlovakAid

description.narrative: Taita Taveta County (schools: Moi High Kasigau, Buguta Secondary, Marungu Secondary, Kajire Secondary, Mwambiti Secondary, Mwaghogho Secondary, Mwakitawa Secondary, Murray Girls, PJ Mwangola, Chala Secondary)
Kasigau Wildlife Trust - instalment 1, Cont./Z/2013/52 project SAMRS/2013/KE/01/12

sector.narrative: Disbursement to KWT in 2013 for technical equipment and the support of IT clubs and student practice companies at ten secondary schools in Taita Taveta County
Total sum of disbursements to KWT in 2014 for technical equipment and support of IT Clubs ant student practice companies at ten secondary schools in Taita Taveta County

description.narrative: Total budget expenditure on the project activities heading (training, technical support, activities of ICT Clubs and training companies.

Total budget expenditure on the technical equipment heading (computers, projectors, modems, smart boards, cameras, printers copiers, etc.) from the beginning of the project on 19 August 2013 until reporting on 30 August 2014
The total sum of four disbursements to KWT during 2015

sector.narrative: Disbursements to KWT were used to support IT Clubs and student practice companies at ten secondary schools in Taita Taveta County.

title.narrative: At least 20 student training companies will be established and join Practice Enterprise Network

description.narrative: At least 20 student training companies will be established and join Practice Enterprise Network. these companies have a clear membership and structure and work within soteICT Clubs on the development of their products - simulation of real business cases.

title.narrative: Student training company that is registered both in Slovak Training Firms Centre and Practice Enterprise network

description.narrative: Twenty student training companies are networked together and form a cluster where they simulate trading and business cases. The objective is for students to learn business communication, CV writing, video creation, presentation skills and put the knowledge of both ICT and Business Studies into practical use and also cooperate with Slovak students.

comment.narrative: In 2013 nine student training companies were estalbished from the previous project (pontis-SAMRS/2011/02/08). These were at schools Moi High, Marungu, Mwakitawa, Kajire, Mwaghogho
twenty new student companies will be established at five new schools within their soteICT Clubs.

As of July 2014 there are 15 new student training companies at schools Marungu, Mwakitawa, Murray Girls, Mwangola, Chala. They joined the 5 schools from previous activities where there were nine student companies from 2013. (Marungu Secondary has Mshindi KCB student company from 2013 and last project, this year they established GreenBird Insurance)

title.narrative: Five new high schools in Taita Taveta will join receive new computer labs and establish ICT Clubs and Student practice companies.

description.narrative: Five new high schools in Taita Taveta will receive new computer labs and equipment. Five new ICT Clubs will be created and students will engage in project-based learning nad in the next phase the join the other five schools from previous project and establish student practice companies based on the Practice Enterprise Network methodology
Five schools will receive computers labs }servers, computers, laptops, interactive whiteboards, projectors, copy machines, internet connection and extensive ongoing training)

comment.narrative: In 2013 we completed a project at five high schools in the Taita Taveta ( computer labs, ICT clubs, competitions with Slovak schools, project-based learning, student companies, teacher trainings...)

Our project has specific indicators for each target group (e.g. teachers, students,student companies, ICT Clubs, projects between schools) but as of now we indicate that five schools will fully join and actively participate in all activities. We will ad more detailed indicators later.
three schools completed the first phase of equipment instillation as of December 2013 (PJ Mwangola Secondary, Murray Girls, Chala Secondary)

title.narrative: Creation of 5 new soteICT Clubs at schools

description.narrative: Five new soteICT Clubs at Mwakitawa, Chala, Mwangola, Murray, Buguta will have student members and operate on a weekly basis with a plan of activities for each school term.
soteICT Club with a list of members, defined structure and plan of activities is established. The output of the activities can be seen at https://www.facebook.com/soteICT

comment.narrative: In the former project (activity pontis-SAMRS/2011/02/08) we have established 5 soteICT Clubs at Moi High, Marrungu, Mwambiti, Kajire, Mwaghogho
Five new soteICT Clubs at Mwakitawa, Chala, Mwangola, Murray, Buguta will have student members and operate on a weekly basis with a plan of activities for each school term.

Five new soteICT Clubs at Mwakitawa, Chala, Mwangola, Murray, Buguta were established and have student members and operate on a weekly basis with a plan of activities and output in the form of essay, CV, video competition entries and more visible at https://www.facebook.com/soteICT
